explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Not pyrophoric when in contact with air at ordinary temperatures; the auto-ignition temperature is 620degC (ICSC, 2004)

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not fluorine and chlorine), with the oxygen bound to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements)

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Classified into Division 6.1 (UN#2078) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods)

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "liquid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in HSDB (2005): "Inhalation, ingestion or contact (skin, eyes) with vapors, dusts or substance may cause severe injury, burns, or death; Reaction with water or moist air will release toxic, corrosive or flammable gases; Reaction with water may generate much heat, which will increase the concentration of fumes in the air; Fire will produce irritating, corrosive and/or toxic gases; Runoff from fire control or dilution water may be corrosive and/or toxic and cause pollution," and in ICSC (J) (1998): Short-tem exposure to the substance causes "redness, burning sensation and pain," with reference to EU Risk Phrase (Category Xi: Irritating).

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on human eye irritation (DFGOT vol.20 (2005)): Irritation of the eyes and nose more severe than with 2,4-TDI. The substance is considered "severely irritating" to the eyes. Classified into Category Xi (Irritating) by EU Risk Phrase.

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.hazard_statement: May cause allergy or asthma symptoms or breathing difficulties if inhaled
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Based on the classification by the Japan Society for Occupational Health (2005) (Respiratory Tract, Group 1).

germ_cell_mutagenicity.hazard_statement: May cause an allergic skin reaction
germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on the classification by the Japan Society for Occupational Health (2005) (Skin, Group 2) and ACGIH-TLV (2005) (SEN).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Data on tests in vivo are not available, while some of the results of mutagenicity tests in vitro (reverse mutation tests, chromosome aberration tests) show positive. No description is available for data on mutagenicity tests in vivo showing negative. Classification is based on GHS definition.

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is classified as Category A4 by ACGIH (2001), Group 2B by IARC 71 (1999) and Category 2B according to Recommendations by the Japan Society of Occupational Health (2004), and priority was given to the IARC classification, following the guidelines.

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs (respiratory system)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence including: eye/skin/respiratory irritation; chemical bronchitis, pneumonia, pulmonary edema (associated with inhalation of the vapour) (ICSC (J) 1995)).

aspiration_hazard.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Not classified from 96 hours LC50=164mg/L of the fish (Fathead minnows) (HSDB (2004)). In addition, methyl-1,3-phenylene diisocyanate (isomer mixture of this substance) was classified into Category 1.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since acute toxicity was classified into Not classified (acute toxicity is not reported within the aqueous solubility concentrations) and the bio-accumulation was low (log Kow=3.74 (PHYSPROP Database (2005))), it was classified into Not classified. In addition, the chronic toxicity of methyl-1,3-phenylene diisocyanate (isomer mixture of this substance) was classified into Category 1.
